{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The main functionality is actually provided by the function below. main is just a wrapper that parses command-line arguments.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Directory where the zip files are stored

{% raw %} 
directory = pathlib.Path.cwd() / 'samples'
assert directory.exists()
directory

Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples')
{% endraw %}

Processing a single zip file

{% raw %}

cli_process_zip[source]

cli_process_zip(args:list=None)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
zip_file = directory /'yearly' / 'PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_2018.zip'
assert zip_file.exists()
print(f'{zip_file=}')

zip_file=Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/yearly/PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_2018.zip')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
output_file = directory / 'year_2018.parquet'
print(f'{output_file=}')

output_file=Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/year_2018.parquet')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
args = [zip_file.as_posix(), output_file.as_posix()]
cli_process_zip(args)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

Extending historical data

A function to extend an existing parquet file with new data in a zip file.

{% raw %}

cli_extend_parquet_with_zip[source]

cli_extend_parquet_with_zip(args:list=None)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Testing with some sample files

{% raw %} 
history_file = directory /'2018-2021_20samples.parquet'
assert history_file.exists()
print(f'{history_file=}')

history_file=Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/2018-2021_20samples.parquet')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
new_zip_file = directory / 'PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_202201_28-29.zip'
assert new_zip_file.exists()
print(f'{new_zip_file=}')

new_zip_file=Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_202201_28-29.zip')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
output_file = directory / 'extended_sample.parquet'
output_file

Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/extended_sample.parquet')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
args = [history_file.as_posix(), new_zip_file.as_posix(), output_file.as_posix()]
cli_extend_parquet_with_zip(args)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

Reading a bunch of zip files

It receives a list of zip files and returns a (column-hierarchical) pd.DataFrame encompassing all the data

{% raw %}

read_zips[source]

read_zips(files:list)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Let us pick a couple of files for testing

{% raw %} 
zip_files = ['PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_2018.zip', 'PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_2019.zip']
zip_files = [directory/ 'yearly' / e for e in zip_files]
zip_files

[Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/yearly/PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_2018.zip'),
 Path('/export/usuarios01/mvazquez/Sync/git/dlsproc/samples/yearly/PlataformasAgregadasSinMenores_2019.zip')]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
df = read_zips(zip_files)
df.head()

CLI

A companion function to allow using the above from the command-line.

{% raw %}

cli_read_zips[source]

cli_read_zips(args:list=None)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cli_read_zips([e.as_posix() for e in zip_files] + '-o o.parquet'.split())
